New Records: Anthony Davis tied a franchise record for the most consecutive 30-point games to start the season with Elgin Baylor, Jerry West, and Kobe Bryant.
Key Match Events: LeBron James scored 16 of his game-high 32 points in a three-minute span in the fourth quarter.
James was responsible for 18 points during the Lakers' 21-0 run to start the fourth quarter.
Anthony Davis hit a 3-pointer and added a free throw in the final minute to give Los Angeles the edge.
LeBron James achieved the 113th triple-double of his career with 32 points, 14 rebounds, and 10 assists.
Post-Match Reflections: LeBron James expressed that his fourth-quarter burst isn't necessary for entire games for Los Angeles to win this season.
Anthony Davis praised LeBron James, stating he continues to show why he's the greatest.
Lakers coach JJ Redick commented on LeBron James' continued greatness, calling it 'actually insane'.
